security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill containing agent instructions for document analysis. No executable code, network calls, or filesystem access beyond standard file I/O operations. The skill explicitly prohibits script-based analysis shortcuts and enforces manual review protocols.

content.value_statement: Process historical documents related to Indigenous governance and sovereignty claims. This skill ensures legal-grade accuracy through verbatim transcription and proper citation protocols. It helps researchers and legal teams organize evidence about Chief authority and title assertions.
actual_capabilities: Process JSON task files for governance documents
Analyze historical records for Chief/Council authority evidence
Apply legal-grade verbatim and citation protocols
Extract and verify document metadata and provenance
Flag corrupted or irrelevant documents for review
Generate structured analysis outputs in JSON format
limitations: Requires JSON task input files to function
Cannot process images or PDFs directly
Does not perform OCR on document images
Manual analysis required for each document

use_cases.title: Process Title Claim Evidence
use_cases.description: Index historical documents for Indigenous title claims with proper citation and provenance tracking.

use_cases.title: Organize Governance Records
use_cases.description: Transcribe and catalog records of Chief authority and self-government assertions.

use_cases.title: Document Sovereignty History
use_cases.description: Compile evidence of resistance to federal imposition for community records.

prompt_templates.title: Process Document Batch
prompt_templates.prompt: Process this governance document batch using the Governance_Sovereignty protocol. Read the JSON task file, analyze each document for Chief/Council authority references, and generate the analysis JSON output with proper citations.

prompt_templates.title: Verify Document Provenance
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify the provenance of this document. Check if the source field indicates valid origin. Flag any tasks where provenance is 'Incoming' or 'Unknown'.

prompt_templates.title: Extract Key Evidence
prompt_templates.prompt: Read through this document and extract verbatim quotes that show assertions of title, self-government, or resistance to federal imposition. Include page numbers and brief context for each quote.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Analysis Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate the complete analysis JSON for this batch. Include task_id, doc_id, title, date, provenance, reliability, ocr_status, relevance, factual summary, forensic context, and key evidence quotes for each document.

output: Document 1: 1913 Letter from O'Reilly to Ditchburn regarding IR10
Date: 1913 | Provenance: Archives of British Columbia
Relevance: High - Contains Chief authority references
Key Evidence: 'Chief Tetlanetea refused to accept the payment...'

best_practices: Re-read the instruction file after every 5 tasks to prevent context drift
Always verify document metadata against actual content, not filenames
Use verbatim quotes rather than paraphrasing for key evidence
anti_patterns: Writing scripts to automate document analysis instead of manual review
Using opinion words like 'likely' or 'suggests' in analysis output
Submitting 'Unknown' for metadata when information exists in the document

faq.question: What input format does this skill require?
faq.answer: This skill processes JSON task files containing document metadata and text content. The JSON must follow the standard task schema with batch_id, tasks array, and system instructions.

faq.question: Can this skill read PDFs directly?
faq.answer: No. This skill reads JSON files and analyzes text content. It cannot read PDF files directly. Use the OCR pipeline for document text extraction first.

faq.question: What output format does this skill produce?
faq.answer: The skill generates structured JSON output files named [Batch_ID]_Analysis.json containing document analysis with metadata, provenance, and key evidence quotes.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill processes data locally through the AI agent. It only reads files specified in the task and writes analysis output. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why does this skill prohibit writing analysis scripts?
faq.answer: The skill enforces manual analysis to ensure human-like judgment. Scripts cannot properly identify contextual matches for governance concepts like implicit Chief authority.

faq.question: How does this compare to general document processing skills?
faq.answer: This skill is specialized for Indigenous governance and sovereignty documents. It includes legal-grade protocols, specific terminology awareness, and strict factual-only output requirements.
